summary: The Energy Circuit Riders Act of 2025 establishes a program to provide grants to eligible entities (states, tribes, nonprofits, etc.) to hire, train, and retain "Energy Circuit Riders." These riders will offer technical assistance and support to rural communities for energy efficiency and clean energy projects. The bill defines the roles of the Energy Circuit Riders, outlines grant eligibility, prioritizes applications recommended by state rural development offices, and mandates information sharing and reports to Congress. It authorizes $25 million annually from 2026-2030 to fund the program.
